ratings.rComments: Professor Boca offers a more theoretical overview of the mathematics presenting in Calculus III. For those that already have some grasp of the material, this will be helpful and perhaps even interesting. For those that are not in that group, going to another professor's section will be beneficial.  Also, if you are struggling, go to office hours!

Florin is actually a  good guy. He tries to teach the best he can but I think many miss out on what he is trying to say, perhaps it is his accent. He goes pretty fast in class;  last 3 minutes, he might cover Stokes Thm. and just touch it lightly in the next lecture which usually is a problem. Go for his office hours if you can - he wants to help.

Boca tends to take the more 'big picture' approach to teaching.  Where other prfessors might do example problems, Boca likes to examine where mathematical conclusions come from.  If you do a little more leg work, you can fully appreciate it.  If you want the grade alone, take another professor.

Don't take this class. Tests were hard for no reason, lectures useless and TA's equally unhelpful. Professors generally messed this class up; math department needs work. Switch out or take at another school, would be my solid advice.

Nice guy, but completely useless at teaching. Only talks theory in lecture, the practice tests are nothing like the real tests and the grading took forever. They curved the class (un-curved average was a D+) but boy, they really screwed up this class up for the fall 2015 semester. Would not recommend. UIUC should very disappointed.

Horrible. Not a good professor in lectures because of his accent is hard to understand. He talks about proofs and does not teach what's in the book. You will feel confuse. Homework takes most of you time to complete. Exams are hard and very different from homework and practice exams. You really need to understand the concepts in order to do well.

Had to teach myself calc 3. If you're like me and are bad at math, you'll struggle mightily. His accent is hard to understand and all he does is go over proofs in class, not actual examples. Take anybody else for math

Seems really smart and knows what he is doing, yet everything is done symbolically in his class. Hard to get past his accent, yet there are other options for you to learn the material. Exams are difficult, but were given a decent curve.

His lectures can go quickly, but there's a lot of subject material to cover in the class that makes that necessary. His accent takes some getting used to, and it can be hard to learn in such a large lecture session, but he is very nice in office hours. The class is taught as a block now so hw/tests are the same no matter what prof you have.

prof boca would not be a good professor in a big lecture setting. i had him for a smaller class and really enjoyed it, really learned a lot. hes much easier to understand and very open to answering questions, very approachable. i was very interested in the content of the course.

One of the smartest men you will ever meet...but that doesn't translate into good teaching. In fact, it's horrible teaching. He doesn't teach any basics. He always jumps to the hardest problems. Homework is WAY too long. Exams are impossible. Office hours confuse you more than in class. He wants to brag about his knowledge rather than teach.

I was confused, so I went to office hours. Somehow he made it worse. Moves too fast and makes you feel stupid if you can't keep up. The book isn't great, but it's a far better teacher than Boca. Avoid if at all possible.

Horrible. Very difficult accent, doesn't teach what's in the book -- and makes it much harder. Tests are impossible (He got a 'U' shaped curve for his tests...what?). Unhelpful, calls things "obvious" when teaching -- and doesn't show anything/work of how he got to the answers. DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH BOCA.
pretty nice guy, and his smart and knowledgeable. though he has accent, but u need to get over it. He gives you enough materials to deal with the test.

I found Boca to be excellent. His accent can be difficult to understand, but understanding accents is a fairly important life skill, so get over it! His proofs in lecture are fascinating and understanding they provide is very important. The class is challenging and a lot of work, but I have gained a great deal from his teaching.

calc3: really nice man but unfortunately not a very good professor. he's very smart but doesn't teach very well, lectures are useless, stopped going after a while (but go to 1st one after exams to find out syllabus). i just got very dependent on reading the book and discussions to explain what the book didn't. HW was long but good practice.

His lessons are catered for the best students in class. If you're good at calculus, his lessons will blow your mind. However, when it comes to the average intelligent student, you need to put in a lot of effort in your own time in order to succeed. Good thing is that, he has very generous curves. As long as you put in the effort, you're fine

I stopped going to lecture after the first test and did better on the following exams. I can't understand his accent. His homework is INSANE (150+ points sometimes). The tests are difficult. Get outside material and attend discussion religiously. Boca's office hours can be helpful. He's a really sweet, kind man. He just can't teach low level math.

I got an A- in this class, but I rarely went to lectures because he leaves you fkin clueless and I rarely did the  because they were just too fkin long! (60 + questions!!) If you are in this class and u feel the same way as i did, go to other prof's lecture. (ppl in other prof's class do way better). also watch youtube tutorials and do mock exams.

He tries really hard and presents a lot of information in lecture, but I never understand any of it. The homework is always ridiculously long and the exams are hard. I'm usually good at math and this class is extremely difficult.

Professor Boca is a mathematical genius who knows everything about the material he teaches. The biggest issue is that he has very high expectations of the class (he lectures very quickly) and he has a strong accent that offputs many students. Still a very wise professor.
Stupidly large amount of homework, crazily complicated indefinite integrals.
Very Bad teacher, cannont understand a words he says, his problems are extra hard compared to other professors who teach the same class.

Worst math class that I have taken. He spends way too much time on unnecessary proofs. His tests are impossible and way harder than the homework and quizzes. I never benefited from going to lecture because he taught so poorly

Ridiculous. Hard to understand, goes very fast, allows no time for questions. Cracks silly math jokes muttering to himself. He seems like a nice cute old man but HORRIBLE teacher. Tests are based on the mock exams, but much harder. Averages around 50-60% but big curve is given. Only 1 A+ in my entire lecture class of at least 300. Do Not take!

unless you are going for a math degree or have a very strong background in calc I and are looking for an A do not take this professor. He teaches fast and everything is based of definitions and not practical application. again be very sure on your calculus ability before you sign up for the class.

His notations and definitions are hard to understand and they appear on the tests, but if you memorize them, you'll be fine. He is a really nice guy, and his mock tests are very helpful, so take them seriously. He curves the overall grading scale in the end, so you'll do a lot better than you think. Go to office hours for help as well.
His accent is a problem but Ta is very good. The test is hard and no extra credit
The worst teacher ever. Can't understand what he is saying at all and tests are impossible. He makes up grades
Aweful teacher! his accent is aweful, you cant always read what he wrote on the board. his tests are hard, and averages are at about a 60%. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!

he sounds like a deaf austrian who has no idea how to connect to children and teach effectively. I wish the earth was actually flat, because i would be sure to walk him to the edge and throw him off, saving thousands of future students 4 months of pain and misery.
Soooo hard..
So hard! He has a horrible accent and going to class is useless. The average of midterms was a 55%. I regret taking this class, take 220!

Hard to understand at first, but gets better as the semester goes on. Has an unfortunate interest in proofs and definitions that show up on exams always, but he grades fair and curves the class so you do not end up doing as bad as you think. A definite genius, but willing to help anyone who seeks assistance.

you can't understand a word this guy says. his tests are ridiculous compared to what examples he goes through in class and the homework he gives. each homework is at least 50 problems and it takes hours to complete. needs to go back to germany because the way he solves problems is completely foreign

firstly, u dont understand what he speaks in class. he has a very strong european accent and he talks really fast. one thing which is really sad is that his exams are wayyy harder than the homework and practise done in class. So you obviously underperform in the exams. He goes really fast in class and many things are UNCLEAR. REALLY BAD CLASS.

The tests were extremely difficult and the homework didn't prepare you at all for the difficulty of problems on the test. His accent is really heavy and just made it impossible to understand him.  I basically had to teach myself the material and did not get a good foundation of calculus because of it.  I would recommend taking another class.
extremely difficult teaching methods.

The biggest thing that one might find hard about this nice professor is his accent. However, I haven't hear anyone having trouble with understanding him. He's always ready for the class. If you have a question he always does his best to explain everything. Well, truthfully, I believe there are better teachers than him, but so far I like him.

Professor Boca is the worst mathematics professor I have had at UIUC; and that is saying a lot because math professors are typically horrible here.  I have no problem with his accent, the problem is his inane penchant for doing examples which will not be on the exam, and are way too hard when the class does not understand the basics.

He was a very good teacher for diffeq.  I previously had taken about a month of the course with a teacher who was infinitely worse, she didn't speak english, he does.  the book was useless but his class notes and lectures were very helpful.  he's the only math teacher i had at u of i that wasn't completely awful at teaching and speaking english.
I had heard all the gory stories about him,but I thought he was an excellent teacher for this course.  He is very helpful and willing to work with you and your schedule

Very intelligent, but terrible at teaching. If you are very good at math, then you'll probably be okay.  He would likely be a decent prof for high level math courses, but I would avoid him for any class under 300 level. Doesn't speak great English, and terrible at explaining concepts.  Also, works straight from notes & doesn't stop for questions.
If you are good at math, you will do fine. If you are a math major, you will get an A. If you have trouble learning math on your own, do not take an intro class with this professor.

Very friendly and helpful , very cool , very nice person. does not teach that well because he is not that fluent in english but is a great researcher in his field. easy exams and reasonable homeworks. Overall very good.
I dropped this class last semester it was so terrible. DEFINITELY AVOID!

The worst professor I have ever had in my entire life.  He is horrible at teaching.  You can't understand him.  He thinks that you understand things and makes the exams extremely hard.  The average was a 45%.  And he wont curve the exams!  You have no clue as to how you are doing in the class.  Horrible!  The math department should fire him.
He is extremely difficult, avoid him at all costs.  Hard to understand and a bad educator overall.  He is intelligent, just a horrible teacher.

He's probably the worst math teacher that I've ever had. That's about 7 years of math teachers, and he wins. His tests are ridiculously hard, he doesn't acknowledge that students are struggling, and is overall very hard to approach. You ask him a question, and he makes you feel like an idiot. Avoid classes taught by him!
Run for your life!

This guy sucks. He is out of his mind, and he don't know what to teach. And as someone says he may be a genius but he is extremely poor at teaching and making exams. There is no curve and average of hourly exam is like 30 out of 100. He is mad

This guy is like a Gottheil(econ) in math class. He might be genious but extremely sucks at teaching. You basically have to understand the material by yourself or through TA section. Some TAs like Anna Maria Popa will be helpful..
extremely hard exam and grading... out of 200 students, there were 3 A 10 A-
just hate him. His TA teaches better than himself.
